message.content: This question requires an understanding of scientific experiments and the role of microbes in producing biofuels. Scientists are experimenting to develop microbes that can use surplus electricity and CO2 to produce organic products such as methane, acetate, and butanol. These organic products can then be used as economic biofuels. Option (B) is incorrect because the goal of the experiments is to produce more biofuels, not less. Option (C) is incorrect because the focus of the experiments is on using surplus electricity and CO2, not solar energy. Option (D) is incorrect because the goal of the experiments is to produce more biofuels, not fewer.

This question requires knowledge about scientific experiments related to developing microbes. Scientists are experimenting to develop microbes that can use surplus electricity and CO2 to produce organic products such as methane, acetate, and butanol. These organic products can then be used as biofuels, which are a more sustainable and economic alternative to fossil fuels. Option (B) is incorrect because the goal of the experiment is to produce more biofuels, not less electricity and more CO2. Option (C) is incorrect because the experiment does not involve using solar energy to produce biofuels. Option (D) is incorrect because the goal is to produce more biofuels like butanol, not fewer, and use the excess CO2.

Option (C) is incorrect because the experiment is focused on utilizing surplus electricity and CO2, not solar energy. Option (D) is incorrect because the goal of the experiment is to produce more biofuels, not fewer.
